title: Connectome Predictive Modelling in R
text: simple use package. Just shape connectivity matrix subjects edges matrix, .e., row contains correlation matrix (removed diagonal duplicated values, e.g., lower triangular data) subject, behavior data vector feed cpm() function.
code: library(cpmr)  withr::local_seed(123) conmat <- matrix(rnorm(100 * 1000), nrow = 100) behav <- rnorm(100) res <- cpm(conmat, behav, kfolds = 10, return_edges = "sum") res #> CPM results: #>   Call: cpm(conmat = conmat, behav = behav, kfolds = 10, return_edges = "sum") #>   Number of observations: 100 #>     Complete cases: 100 #>   Number of edges: 1000 #>   Parameters: #>     Confounds:        FALSE #>     Threshold method: alpha #>     Threshold level:  0.01 #>     CV folds:         10 #>     Bias correction:  TRUE summary(res) #> CPM summary: #>   Performance (Pearson): #>     Positive: -0.114 #>     Negative: -0.270 #>     Combined: -0.225 #>   Prop. edges (50% folds): #>     Positive: 0.40% #>     Negative: 0.10%

title: Perform Connectome-based Predictive Modeling (CPM) — cpm
code: cpm(   conmat,   behav,   ...,   confounds = NULL,   thresh_method = c("alpha", "sparsity"),   thresh_level = 0.01,   kfolds = NULL,   bias_correct = TRUE,   return_edges = c("sum", "none", "all"),   na_action = c("fail", "exclude") )

title: Perform Connectome-based Predictive Modeling (CPM) — cpm
text: conmat matrix connectome data. Observations row, edges column (assumed duplicated edges removed). behav numeric vector contains behavior data. Length must equal number observations conmat. Note behav also row/column matrix, converted vector using drop(). ... future extension. Currently ignored. confounds matrix confounding variables. Observations row, variables column. NULL, confounding variables used. Note vector provided, converted column matrix. thresh_method, thresh_level threshold method level used edge selection. method set "alpha", edge selection based critical value correlation coefficient. method set "sparsity", edge selection based quantile correlation coefficient, thus network sparsity controlled. kfolds Folds number cross-validation. NULL, set equal number observations, .e., leave-one-subject-. bias_correct Logical value indicating connectome data bias-corrected. TRUE, connectome data centered scaled unit variance based training data model fitting prediction. See Rapuano et al. (2020) details. return_edges character string indicating return value selected edges. "none", edges returned. "sum", sum selected edges across folds returned. "", selected edges fold returned, 3D array memory-consuming. na_action character string indicating action missing values found behav. "fail", error thrown. "exclude", missing values excluded analysis kept output. Note complete cases intersection conmat, behav confounds provided.

title: Perform Connectome-based Predictive Modeling (CPM) — cpm
text: list following components: folds corresponding fold observation used test group cross-validation. real real behavior data. input behav confounds NULL, otherwise residual behav regressing confounds. pred predicted behavior data, column corresponding model, .e., edges, positive edges, negative edges, row names corresponding observation names (behav). edges selected edges, return_edges "none". return_edges "sum", matrix rows corresponding edges columns corresponding networks. return_edges "", 3D array dimensions corresponding edges, networks folds. call matched call. params list parameters used function, including: confounds indicating confounds used thresh_method indicating threshold method thresh_level indicating threshold level kfolds indicating number folds cross-validation bias_correct indicating bias correction used
